verses.roman:
tṛṣita cātaka yaiche kare hāhākāra
taiche ei saba,-sabe kara aṅgīkāra

synonyms: tṛṣita—thirsty; cātaka—the cātaka bird; yaiche—just as; kare—does; hāhā-kāra—vibration of disappointment; taiche—similarly; ei saba—all of these; sabe—all of them; kara aṅgīkāra—kindly accept.
translation: "In Your absence all these people have been exactly like thirsty cātaka birds crying in disappointment. Kindly accept them."
